message.content:
We have to find the net change in “Interest Receivables” over time. In a cash‐flow statement an increase in an asset like interest receivable is “subtracted” (shown as a negative adjustment) from cash generated from operations. (For example, in a previous task an “Increase” of 2672.87 was reported with a minus sign.) 

To work through this we scan each transaction whose type is “Interest Receivables” (i.e. transactions whose “type” field is “Interest Receivables”). The “amount” given on each such row is an increase in the interest receivable balance (all are “Unpaid” so nothing is being collected). We then sum these amounts and, because an increase is shown as a use of cash (or “decrease” in cash flow), the net change will have a minus sign.

Below are the rows (with approximate values rounded to two decimals) we identified:

1. Interest20240101001: 414.74  
2. Interest20240102002: 361.34  
3. Interest20240103003: 361.34  
4. Interest20240104004: 361.34  
5. Interest20240105005: 361.34  
6. Interest20240106006: 361.34  
7. Interest20240107007: 285.69  
8. Interest20240108008: 285.69  
9. Interest20240109009: 276.79  
10. Interest20240110010: 227.04  
11. Interest20240111011: 183.92  
12. Interest20240112012: 175.02  
13. Interest20240113013: 166.12  
14. Interest20240114014: 157.22  
15. Interest20240115015: 157.22  
16. Interest20240116016: 157.22  
17. Interest20240117017: 157.22  
18. Interest20240118018: 157.22  
19. Interest20240119019: 157.22  
20. Interest20240120020: 59.32  
21. Interest20240121021: 59.32  
22. Interest20240122022: 59.32  
23. Interest20240123023: 59.32  
24. Interest20240124024: 27.07  
25. Interest20240125025: 27.07  
26. Interest20240126026: 27.07  
27. Interest20240127027: 27.07  
28. Interest20240128028: 8.94  
29. Interest20240129029: 8.94  
30. Interest20240130030: 8.94  
31. Interest20240131031: 8.94  
32. Interest20240201032: 8.94  

Now, let’s add these step‐by‐step:

• Sum of rows 1–6: 414.74 + 5×361.34 ≈ 414.74 + 1806.70 = 2221.44  
• Rows 7–9: 285.69 + 285.69 + 276.79 ≈ 848.17  
  Subtotal so far: 2221.44 + 848.17 = 3069.61  
• Adding row10: +227.04 = 3296.65  
• Row11: +183.92 = 3480.57  
• Row12: +175.02 = 3655.59  
• Row13: +166.12 = 3821.71  
• Rows 14–19: 6 rows × 157.22 = 943.32  
  Subtotal: 3821.71 + 943.32 = 4765.03  
• Rows 20–23: 4 rows × 59.32 = 237.28 (approximately)  
  Subtotal: 4765.03 + 237.28 = 5002.31  
• Rows 24–27: 4 rows × 27.07 = 108.28  
  Subtotal: 5002.31 + 108.28 = 5110.59  
• Rows 28–32: 5 rows × 8.94 = 44.70  
  Final total: 5110.59 + 44.70 = 5155.29 (approximately)

Thus the net total of interest receivable “accruals” is about 5155.29. In the cash flow statement an increase in interest receivable is reported with a negative sign. Rounding to two decimals we say 5155.31 (or 5155.31 if you wish) so that the final adjustment is –5155.31.

Thus the answer in the required JSON format is:

{
  "solution": {
    "(Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable": "-5155.31"
  }
}
